title.narrative: 1.6 JUSTICE & PROTECTION OF CHILDREN -CP

description.narrative: Enhanced national capacity to improve access to justice and protection of children in contact with the law, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, there is an inclusive and protective legal and policy environment and improved state accountability for the realization of children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced national capacity to improve access to justice and protection of children in contact with the law

description.narrative: Child-friendly and gender-sensitiveinvestigation procedures for cases involving child survivors of violence were improved to increase children’s ability to give effective testimony, while protecting them from hardship and trauma during investigation processes. A legislative initiative for a comprehensive Law on Justice for Children was included in the law-making agenda of the National Assembly in the next five years. | Status:Met | As-of Date:03/02/2022

title.narrative: Number of child justice trainings institutionalized by relevant justice professional academies/universities(49648)

actual.value: 2021:2: A Child Justice Training Prog by HLU and one foundational child justice training prog by Court Academy.

title.narrative: Number of functioning Family and Juvenile Courts(49649)

actual.value: 2021:41: 38 F&JC at provincial level, 03 at high courts

actual.value: 2021:Yes: A new sublaw on child friendly investigation adopted.
